title: Ticket #2070: condor-reconfig changing slot type count = crash
description:
I implemented a policy like this. Dan B. and I tested it on a personal condor. 

SLOT_TYPE_1 = mem=5%
SLOT_TYPE_2 = mem=auto
SLOT_TYPE_3 = mem=6.25%
SLOT_TYPE_4 = mem=auto
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = ifThenElse($(DETECTED_MEMORY)<=(33*1024), 10, 0)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_2 = ifThenElse($(DETECTED_MEMORY)<=(33*1024), 2, 0)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_3 = ifThenElse($(DETECTED_MEMORY)>(33*1024), 10, 0)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_4 = ifThenElse($(DETECTED_MEMORY)>(33*1024), 2, 0)

We tried varying the number of the types of slots. To our surprise we were able to do a condor_reconfig and the startd spawned new slots. On the other hand, we started with 2 slots (from 2 types), moved to 1 slot from 1 type and then tried increasing to 3 slots from 3 types. At this point the startd crashed.
